With the 20 years of .NET that's happening now and also the [Celebrating 20 Years of .NET: Entity Framework][1] I realized, I have a piece of history that would be too bad to lose.

<!-- excerpt -->

You might remember that Firebird's code, and _FirebirdClient_ was no exception, was hosted on SourceForge in CVS originally. When _FirebirdClient_ moved to SVN (another part of history), it was simply imported as a "current state", without any history. Later another move to Git was done, this time with complete history. Hence the [history starts][2] with import to SVN basically.

But some months ago, I decided, before CVS on SourceForge is completely lost, to at least dump the CVS history of `NETProvider`. To preserve it for future generations. :) 

It was quite a journey to find the tools, connect and eventually dump the history log. Hopefully everything worked fine and here it is. You can start digging through (somewhat unordered) history.

revision 1.135
date: 2004/01/24 23:56:58;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +21 -0
2004-01-24 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* source/FbCommand.cs:
	* source/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"
		exception.

	* source/GdsStatement.cs:

		- Removed the support for implicit transactions, that now is located in the FbCommand class.
----------------------------

2003-11-15 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.
----------------------------

	* source/FbCommand.cs:
	* source/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"
		exception.

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

	* source/FbCommand.cs:
	* source/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"
		exception.

	* source/GdsStatement.cs:

		- Removed the support for implicit transactions, that now is located in the FbCommand class.

2003-11-15 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

2003-11-15 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

2003-11-15 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

revision 1.3
date: 2003/11/16 15:17:30;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +6 -13
2003-11-16 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Reworked the nunit test suite for allow database creation in the fly (not finished yet)

	* source/FbCommand.cs:
	* source/GDS/GdsInetWriter.cs:

		- Added changes for allow better andling of query parameters, making
		data conversions only one time.

2003-11-15 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Changes to the character support (Thanks to Peter Jacobi and Oleg Ufaev), includes:

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			Encode strings with field character set when NONE is used as default character set.

		* source/GDS/GdsField.cs

			New property CharCount that will be used to retrieve the length in characters of
			character fields instead of use SqlLen that is the length in bytes.

		* source/GDS/GdsInetReader.cs

			If the length of the readed data (in characters) is greater than the CharCount of
			the field, return only CharCount characters ( this will be made using the Charset
			information for the current field ).

		* source/FbDataReader.cs:

			In the GetSchema method save in the ColumnSize field the real number of characters
			for character fields, instead of the length in bytes.

revision 1.242
date: 2004/08/10 14:19:57;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +25 -0
2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)
----------------------------

revision 1.236
date: 2004/08/04 11:28:41;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +70 -0
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

2004-04-23 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbDataReader.cs:
	* FirebirdSql.Data.Gds/GdsStatement.cs:
	* FirebirdSql.Data.Fes/FesStatement.cs:

		- Improved DataReader implementation:

			- Make it more readable and maintenable.

			- Changed open field by isClosed.

			- Changed consstructor parameters.

			- Improved exception handling, now it's more close to SqlClient,
			the sample used for test it in SqlClient was:


			string sql = "SELECT * FROM Customers";

			SqlConnection connection = new SqlConnection(connectionString);
			connection.Open();

			SqlCommand command = new SqlCommand(sql, connection);

			SqlDataReader reader = command.ExecuteReader();
			while(reader.Read())
			{
			}

			// Add calls to reader methos ere

			reader.Close();

			// Add calls to reader methos ere

			connection.Close();

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommand.cs:

		- Added new Close, Drop, Fetch and GetFieldsDescriptor methods.

		- Removed Statement property.

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbConnection.cs:

		- Make use of the new FbCommand.Drop method.

revision 1.133
date: 2004/03/22 18:33:40;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +21 -0
2004-03-22 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommandBuilder.cs:

		- Added some changes (some of them are checked against SqlClient
		working with MSDE 2000 Release A):

			1. Improved Dispose and RefreshSchema implementations,
			Set to null the Insert, Delete and Update commands of the related
			DataAdapter, when needed, in the RefreshSchema method.

			2. Make use of the DataTableMapping.GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction method
			and of the DataColumnMapping.GetDataColumnBySchemaAction for extract the
			DataColumn that matches a given parameter.

			3. Improved Command generation, we can't generate always
			a new command, in the RowUpdating handler when the given
			command is different than the command builder command
			we can do the build of a new one.

			4. Restrict the connection opening (when it's closed) to the
			buildSchemaTable method.
----------------------------

revision 1.71
date: 2004/01/24 23:55:46;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +18 -0
2004-01-24 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommand.cs:
	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"
		exception.
----------------------------

revision 1.9
date: 2004/08/04 11:27:36;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +102 -4
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

		- Improved DataReader implementation:

			- Make it more readable and maintenable.

			- Changed open field by isClosed.

			- Changed consstructor parameters.

			- Improved exception handling, now it's more close to SqlClient,
			the sample used for test it in SqlClient was:


			string sql = "SELECT * FROM Customers";

			SqlConnection connection = new SqlConnection(connectionString);
			connection.Open();

			SqlCommand command = new SqlCommand(sql, connection);

			SqlDataReader reader = command.ExecuteReader();
			while(reader.Read())
			{
			}

			// Add calls to reader methos ere

			reader.Close();

			// Add calls to reader methos ere

			connection.Close();

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Gds/GdsStatement.cs:

		The SqlCommand.Connection documentation says:

			If you set Connection while a transaction is in progress and the Transaction

		That exception is now removed from FbCommand.Connection property.

2004-03-22 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommandBuilder.cs:

		- Added some changes (some of them are checked against SqlClient
		working with MSDE 2000 Release A):

			1. Improved Dispose and RefreshSchema implementations,
			Set to null the Insert, Delete and Update commands of the related
			DataAdapter, when needed, in the RefreshSchema method.

			2. Make use of the DataTableMapping.GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction method
			and of the DataColumnMapping.GetDataColumnBySchemaAction for extract the
			DataColumn that matches a given parameter.

			3. Improved Command generation, we can't generate always
			a new command, in the RowUpdating handler when the given
			command is different than the command builder command
			we can do the build of a new one.

			4. Restrict the connection opening (when it's closed) to the
			buildSchemaTable method.

revision 1.15
date: 2004/01/24 21:53:57;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +87 -24
2004-01-24 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommand.cs:
	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"
		exception.
----------------------------

revision 1.37
date: 2004/08/10 14:16:35;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)
----------------------------
revision 1.36
date: 2004/08/04 11:25:03;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +55 -51
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

date: 2004/03/22 18:32:56;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +203 -228
2004-03-22 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommandBuilder.cs:

		- Added some changes (some of them are checked against SqlClient
		working with MSDE 2000 Release A):

			1. Improved Dispose and RefreshSchema implementations,
			Set to null the Insert, Delete and Update commands of the related
			DataAdapter, when needed, in the RefreshSchema method.

			2. Make use of the DataTableMapping.GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction method
			and of the DataColumnMapping.GetDataColumnBySchemaAction for extract the
			DataColumn that matches a given parameter.

			3. Improved Command generation, we can't generate always
			a new command, in the RowUpdating handler when the given
			command is different than the command builder command
			we can do the build of a new one.

			4. Restrict the connection opening (when it's closed) to the
			buildSchemaTable method.

revision 1.42
date: 2004/08/04 11:25:03;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +26 -13
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.7
date: 2004/01/24 21:53:57;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +24 -14
2004-01-24 Carlos Guzmán Álvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbCommand.cs:
	* FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/FbDataReader.cs:

		- Changes in implicit transaction support.
		Now, the transaction will be commited after each execution,
		if there are any error the transaction will be automatically rollbacked,
		in the Dispose method the transaction will be ROLLBACKED.
		In the case of ExecuteReader the transaction will commited when the DataReader is closed.

		- The FbCommand.parseParameters will ceck the length in bytes of the char/varchar
		paranmeters for ensure that is correct, in the case the length of the parameter
		value is greater than the number of bytes allowed by the parameter the provider
		will throw an "arithmetic exception, numeric overflow, or string truncation"

date: 2004/08/10 14:19:30;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +44 -42
2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)
----------------------------
revision 1.7
date: 2004/08/04 11:25:03;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +60 -63
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.16
date: 2004/08/04 11:25:03;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +78 -174
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.10
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.11
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.9
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.1
date: 2004/08/04 11:25:35;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
=============================================================================

revision 1.14
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +30 -30
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)

revision 1.10
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +24 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.11
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +16 -11
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.10
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +1 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.10
date: 2004/08/04 11:26:45;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +24 -1
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

revision 1.6
date: 2004/08/04 11:28:04;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;  lines: +209 -233
2004-04-04 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Backported the DAtabase schema support changes from v1.7

        This includes:

        * New FbConnection methods

            - GetChema()
            - GetSchema(string)
            - GetSchema(string[])

        * Change the names of the FbDbSchemaType elements to remove the underscore.

        * Update all the classes in the FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird/DbSchema directory.

        * Update the implementation of the FbCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters static method.

        * Update the TypeHelper and FbParameter classes to implement the new data type helper methods.

        Some of the changes in the Schema Results are:

        - Data types schema -

        * New schema that will return the data types information.

        - Metadata collections -

        * New schema that will return all the supported schemas, and the number of restrictions of each one.

        - Columns Schema -

        * The COLUMN_DATA_TYPE now holds the datatype name.

        * New columns:

        - IS_ARRAY

        * Removed columns:

        - PROVIDER_TYPE (to known that we can search in the DataTypes schema)
        - PRIMARY_KEY
        - UNIQUE_KEY

        The reason is that the query with that columsn gets a lot time to be executed in complex database (with a lot of tables, columns, etc...)

        - Tables schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TABLE column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Generators schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_GENERATOR column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Functions schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_FUNCTION column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Triggers schema -

        * The IS_SYSTEM_TRIGGER column now will have 0/1 as values

        - Primary keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME

        - Unique keys schema -

        * Now it's possible to filter by COLUMN_NAME
----------------------------

revision 1.1
date: 2004/08/10 14:12:13;  author: carlosga_fb;  state: Exp;
2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)

2004-08-10 Carlos Guzman Alvarez  <carlosga@telefonica.net>

	* Last changes for the database schmeas support:


		* All source files has been renamed to remove
		the Schema suffix (FbTablesSchema.cs -> FbTables.cs)
		The same for the class names.

		* There are a new 'Restrictions' schema that will
		return the restriction columns for each schema.

		* There are new columns in some schemas:

			   XXXX_CATALOG
			   XXXX_SCHEMA

		That will make the returned schemas more
		general and compatible with other databases
		(what will be nice for .net 2.0 as the schema
		support is in the System.Data.Common.DbConnection
		class)

		These new columns are restriction columns as
		well (the value will be null always)
